physical_examinations.vital_signs: Arterial oxygen saturation: 92% on 15 l/min oxygen; pH: 7.24; arterial partial pressure of oxygen: 83 mmHg; arterial partial pressure of carbon dioxide: 59 mmHg; bicarbonate: 23 mM; base excess: Not specified; arterial oxygen saturation: 96%
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: The patient was conscious, hemodynamically stable, with bilateral crackles predominantly on the left side.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: On day 2, dyspnea worsened leading to tracheal intubation, deep sedation, and paralysis. Improvements were noted after 12 hours of prone positioning with PEEPi reducing from 12 cm H2O to 2 cm H2O and lower inflection point improving from 14 cm H2O to 3 cm H2O.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: pH: 7.24; arterial partial pressure of oxygen: 83 mmHg; arterial partial pressure of carbon dioxide: 59 mmHg; bicarbonate: 23 mM; arterial oxygen saturation: 96%
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Worsening of respiratory distress and implementation of mechanical ventilation.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: PEEPi: 12 cm H2O; lower inflection point: 14 cm H2O
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Chest radiograph showed bilateral alveolointerstitial infiltrates. ARDS persisted.
Patient successfully weaned from the ventilator.
Patient discharged from the intensive care unit.
